definition: the quality imparted to voiced speech sounds by the action of the resonating chambers of the throat and mouth and nasal cavities
details:
noun
- the quality imparted to voiced speech sounds by the action of the resonating chambers of the throat and mouth and nasal cavities
- having the character of a loud deep sound
= synonyms: plangency, reverberance, ringing, sonorousness, sonority, vibrancy
- a vibration of large amplitude produced by a relatively small vibration near the same frequency of vibration as the natural frequency of the resonating system
- an excited state of a stable particle causing a sharp maximum in the probability of absorption of electromagnetic radiation
- a relationship of mutual understanding or trust and agreement between people
= synonyms: rapport
